newsitem.title: UK: BAA tumbles on concerns about Iraq attack.
newsitem.headline: BAA tumbles on concerns about Iraq attack.

text.p: Shares in BAA Plc tumbled to a one-month low amid concern that renewed hostilities in Iraq will hurt its core businesses, traders said.
By 0745 GMT, the shares were down 10-1/2p to 471p.
BAA, which manages airport facilities in the UK and overseas, could see its results dip if the situation in Iraq drags on, traders said.
"BAA's revenue comes from people going through the airport and spending money. If there's a war, that's not going to happen," said one market maker.
Added another, "It's a knee-jerk reaction and I think it's overdone, but people are just nervous."
